title: Reflection on the Use of GenAI
text: For this assessment, I used ChatGPT as a Generative AI tool to support the development of my personal website using Quarto and GitHub Pages.

title: Reflection on the Use of GenAI
text: For this assessment, I used ChatGPT as a Generative AI tool to support the development of my personal website using Quarto and GitHub Pages.

title: Reflection on the Use of GenAI
text:
How GenAI Helped Me
GenAI was particularly helpful in: - Guiding me through the setup of R, RStudio, Quarto, and GitHub Pages
- Explaining technical steps clearly when I encountered errors or confusion
- Helping to structure and refine written content for the website pages
For example, GenAI helped me transform rough notes into well-structured markdown sections suitable for a professional website.

title: Reflection on the Use of GenAI
text:
Benefits of Using GenAI
The main benefits of using GenAI include: - Faster problem-solving when dealing with unfamiliar tools
- Reduced time spent searching through documentation
- Improved clarity and organisation in my writing
This allowed me to focus more on understanding the concepts rather than struggling with formatting or syntax.

title: Reflection on the Use of GenAI
text:
Challenges and Limitations
One challenge was ensuring that I did not rely too heavily on the tool without understanding the underlying steps.
I had to carefully verify instructions and make sure that the final content accurately reflected my own learning and experience.

title: Reflection on the Use of GenAI
text:
Future Use of GenAI
In the future, I see GenAI as a valuable support tool for both study and work, particularly for: - Learning new technologies
- Drafting reports and documentation
- Troubleshooting technical issues
However, I believe it should be used responsibly alongside critical thinking and independent problem-solving.

title: Data Visualization
text:
The chart below shows the daily performance of different marketing channels across a week (Mon–Sun).
Each horizontal bar represents one day, and the bar is divided into five channels: Direct, Mail Ad, Affiliate Ad, Video Ad, and Search Engine.

title: Data Visualization
text:
The chart below shows the daily performance of different marketing channels across a week (Mon–Sun).
Each horizontal bar represents one day, and the bar is divided into five channels: Direct, Mail Ad, Affiliate Ad, Video Ad, and Search Engine.

title: Data Visualization
text:
What is visualised?
This is a stacked horizontal bar chart where the numeric labels on each segment represent the value contributed by each channel on that day.
By stacking the channels, the chart also shows the total daily volume (overall bar length) while still allowing us to see how the total is made up.

title: Data Visualization
text:
Key observations

Search Engine contributes the largest share on every day, and it increases noticeably towards the weekend.
The overall total is higher on Saturday and Sunday, suggesting stronger engagement or conversions on weekends.
Channels like Mail Ad and Affiliate Ad contribute smaller portions, but their contribution remains fairly consistent across the week.

title: Data Visualization
section: Why I chose this chart type
text:
Why I chose this chart type
I chose a stacked bar chart because it allows two comparisons at once: 1. Across days: which day has a higher total. 2. Within a day: how much each channel contributes to that day’s total.
Using a horizontal layout also improves readability of day labels and makes the segment values easier to scan.

title: Data Visualization
text:
Story behind this task
This visualisation was created to communicate marketing performance clearly and quickly.
Instead of listing numbers in a table, the chart makes it obvious which channel drives most results and which days tend to perform better, supporting better decisions on where to focus effort and budget.

title: Project
text: This page describes one of the key projects I have worked on as part of my studies, which focused on analysing data and communicating insights effectively through visualisation.

title: Project
text: This page describes one of the key projects I have worked on as part of my studies, which focused on analysing data and communicating insights effectively through visualisation.

title: Project
text:
Project Title
Marketing Channel Performance Analysis

title: Project
text:
Background
The objective of this project was to analyse how different marketing channels performed across a week and to identify patterns in user engagement.
Rather than relying on raw tables of numbers, the task emphasised the importance of using data visualisation to make comparisons clearer and insights more accessible to decision-makers.

title: Project
text:
My Role
In this project, I was responsible for: - Preparing and organising the dataset for analysis
- Designing an appropriate visualisation to represent multi-channel data
- Interpreting the results and explaining the observed trends
The tools used included spreadsheet software and visualisation techniques commonly applied in data analytics.

title: Project
text:
Key Learning Outcomes
Through this project, I developed: - A stronger understanding of how to visualise quantitative data effectively
- The ability to select suitable chart types for comparative analysis
- Improved data interpretation and communication skills
Overall, this project strengthened my appreciation of how clear visual design can significantly enhance data-driven decision-making.
